title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that helps users visualize and track their accumulated sleep debt over time. It allows users to input their sleep data, calculate the difference between their ideal and actual sleep, and provides a clear visual representation of their sleep debt, promoting better sleep habits and overall well-being. This project serves as a practical application of TypeScript and modern web development principles.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML project that provides a customizable and dynamic event calendar interface. This project allows users to easily display and manage events within a visually appealing calendar, and is built with modularity in mind, enabling easy integration into various web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a modern IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. It leverages Supabase for backend services, providing a robust and scalable platform for tracking and managing assets in real-time. The project demonstrates a full-stack approach to IoT development, focusing on efficient data handling and a user-friendly interface.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially complemented by HTML for online presentation. This project showcases my skills in document creation and web design while providing a clear and concise representation of my qualifications and experience.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a centralized hub for developers. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, providing a smooth and organized experience. The project focuses on creating a customizable and extendable platform for tracking projects and resources.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This project provides a comprehensive dashboard solution focusing on real-time robot monitoring, data visualization, and potentially control functionalities, offering a user-friendly interface for managing and understanding robotic fleet operations.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project management application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, providing a visual and intuitive platform for brainstorming, organizing, and prioritizing ideas within a team. This project utilizes modern web development practices to deliver a dynamic and user-friendly experience for streamlined project planning and execution.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a project exploring decentralized voting systems built with Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, and styled with CSS. It aims to provide a secure and transparent voting platform, focusing on exploring blockchain-based solutions and user-friendly interfaces, as part of a larger investigation into secure and modern voting methodologies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project built using HTML and Python focused on creating interactive map visualizations. It aims to leverage geographic data to present information in a clear and engaging way through a web-based interface. This repository showcases techniques for displaying data geographically, potentially using libraries like Folium or similar tools for map rendering and data integration.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a web application built using Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) project. This repository demonstrates a practical implementation of a full-stack application, showcasing how to connect a Python backend with a PostgreSQL database and create a user interface with HTML/CSS for managing data effectively.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for efficiently visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and understand complex ROS log data, facilitating debugging and performance analysis in ROS-based robotic systems.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern, interactive dashboard project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS, designed to provide a clean and efficient user interface for data visualization and management. This project leverages the power of Next.js to deliver a performant and scalable solution suitable for various data-driven applications.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide engaging and interactive AI-powered conversations. This project explores building a modern web application with a focus on type safety and efficient development, demonstrating the use of cutting-edge technologies for seamless communication with Google's Gemini API and delivering a rich user experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains projects and code examples focused on applying Python to financial analysis. It explores various financial concepts and techniques through practical implementations, providing a hands-on learning resource for those interested in combining finance and programming.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and React, leveraging MUI for a sleek UI and React Query for efficient data fetching. This project demonstrates a complete online store implementation, focusing on core e-commerce functionalities, and showcasing best practices for type-safe development with TypeScript and modern React patterns.
